intro: Meconopsis manasluensis, commonly known as the Manaslu blue poppy, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Nepal and Tibet. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue to violet petals, which are often adorned with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows at elevations above 3,000 meters, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
